intro: Agalmyla ambonica, commonly known as the Madagascar agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and dark green, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
